occi:mixin.title: This is the default (root) TOSCA Capability Type definition that all other TOSCA Capability Types derive from.
The Node capability indicates the base capabilities of a TOSCA Node Type.

This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a network endpoint capability. This includes the information to express a basic endpoint with a single port or a complex endpoint with multiple ports. By default the Endpoint is assumed to represent an address on a private network unless otherwise specified.

occi:attribute.name: port.name
occi:attribute.title: The optional name (or ID) of the network port this endpoint should be bound to.

occi:attribute.name: protocol
occi:attribute.title: The name of the protocol (i.e., the protocol prefix) that the endpoint accepts (any OSI Layer 4-7 protocols) Examples: http, https, ftp, tcp, udp, etc.

occi:attribute.name: port
occi:attribute.title: The optional port of the endpoint.

occi:attribute.name: initiator
occi:attribute.title: The optional indicator of the direction of the connection.

occi:attribute.name: network.name
occi:attribute.title: The optional name (or ID) of the network this endpoint should be bound to. network_name: PRIVATE | PUBLIC |<network_name> | <network_id>

occi:attribute.name: secure
occi:attribute.title: Requests for the endpoint to be secure and use credentials supplied on the ConnectsTo relationship.

occi:attribute.name: ports
occi:attribute.title: The optional map of ports the Endpoint supports (if more than one).

occi:attribute.name: url.path
occi:attribute.title: The optional URL path of the endpoint’s address if applicable for the protocol.

occi:mixin.title: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used to express a scalability capability for a node.

occi:attribute.name: min.instances
occi:attribute.title: This property is used to indicate the minimum number of instances that should be created for the associated TOSCA Node Template by a TOSCA orchestrator.

occi:attribute.name: max.instances
occi:attribute.title: This property is used to indicate the maximum number of instances that should be created for the associated TOSCA Node Template by a TOSCA orchestrator.

occi:attribute.name: default.instances
occi:attribute.title: An optional property that indicates the requested default number of instances that should be the starting number of instances a TOSCA orchestrator should attempt to allocate. Note: The value for this property MUST be in the range between the values set for ‘min_instances’ and ‘max_instances’ properties.

occi:mixin.title: The Container capability, when included on a Node Type or Template definition, indicates that the node can act as a container for (or a host for) one or more other declared Node Types.

occi:attribute.name: disk.size
occi:attribute.title: Size of the local disk available to applications running on the Compute node (default unit is MB).

occi:mixin.title: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a specialized database endpoint capability.

This capability represents a public endpoint which is accessible to the general internet (and its public IP address ranges). This public endpoint capability also can be used to create a floating (IP) address that the underlying network assigns from a pool allocated from the application’s underlying public network. This floating address is managed by the underlying network such that can be routed an application’s private address and remains reliable to internet clients.

occi:attribute.name: floating
occi:attribute.title: Indicates that the public address should be allocated from a pool of floating IPs that are associated with the network.

occi:attribute.name: dns.name
occi:attribute.title: The optional name to register with DNS

occi:mixin.title: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define a specialized administrator endpoint capability.
This is the default TOSCA type that should be used to express an Operating System capability for a node.

occi:attribute.name: type
occi:attribute.title: The Operating System (OS) type. Examples of valid values include: linux, aix, mac, windows, etc.

occi:attribute.name: distribution
occi:attribute.title: The Operating System (OS) distribution. Examples of valid values for an “type” of “Linux” would include: debian, fedora, rhel and ubuntu.

occi:attribute.name: version
occi:attribute.title: The Operating System version.

occi:mixin.title: This is the default TOSCA type that should be used or extended to define an attachment capability of a (logical) infrastructure device node (e.g., BlockStorage node).

This is the default (root) TOSCA Node Type that all other TOSCA nodes should extends. This allows all TOSCA nodes to have a consistent set of features for modeling and management (e.g, consistent definitions for requirements, capabilities, and lifecycle interfaces).

The TOSCA WebApplication node represents a software application that can be managed and run by a TOSCA WebServer node. Specific types of web applications such as Java, etc. could be derived from this type.

occi:attribute.name: context.root
occi:attribute.title: The web application’s context root which designates the application’s URL path within the web server it is hosted on.

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA SoftwareComponent node represents a generic software component that can be managed and run by a TOSCA Compute Node Type.

occi:attribute.name: admin.credential
occi:attribute.title: The optional credential that can be used to authenticate to the software component.

occi:attribute.name: component.version
occi:attribute.title: The optional software component’s version.

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA DBMS node represents a typical relational, SQL Database Management System software component or service.

occi:attribute.name: port
occi:attribute.title: the port the DBMS service will listen to for data and requests

occi:attribute.name: root.password
occi:attribute.title: the optional root password for the DBMS service

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA Compute node represents one or more real or virtual processors of software applications or services along with other essential local resources. Collectively, the resources the compute node represents can logically be viewed as a (real or virtual) “server”.

occi:attribute.name: private.address
occi:attribute.title: The primary private IP address assigned by the cloud provider that applications may use to access the Compute node.

occi:attribute.name: public.address
occi:attribute.title: The primary public IP address assigned by the cloud provider that applications may use to access the Compute node.

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA Load Balancer node represents logical function that be used in conjunction with a Floating Address to distribute an application’s traffic (load) across a number of instances of the application (e.g., for a clustered or scaled application).
This TOSCA WebServer Node Type represents an abstract software component or service that is capable of hosting and providing management operations for one or more WebApplication nodes.
The TOSCA Database node represents a logical database that can be managed and hosted by a TOSCA DBMS node.

occi:attribute.name: password
occi:attribute.title: the optional password for the DB user account

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: the logical name of the database

occi:attribute.name: user
occi:attribute.title: the optional user account name for DB administration

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA Container Application node represents an application that requires Container-level virtualization technology.
The TOSCA Container Runtime node represents operating system-level virtualization technology used to run multiple application services on a single Compute host.
The TOSCA BlockStorage node currently represents a server-local block storage device (i.e., not shared) offering evenly sized blocks of data from which raw storage volumes can be created.

occi:attribute.name: volume.id
occi:attribute.title: ID of an existing volume (that is in the accessible scope of the requesting application).

occi:attribute.name: snapshot.id
occi:attribute.title: Some identifier that represents an existing snapshot that should be used when creating the block storage (volume).

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA Policy Type all other TOSCA Policy Types derive from
The TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern update of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
The TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern placement of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
The TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to govern scaling of TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
The TOSCA Policy Type definition that is used to declare performance requirements for TOSCA nodes or groups of nodes.
The TOSCA Group Type all other TOSCA Group Types derive from
The TOSCA root Interface Type all other TOSCA base Interface Types derive from.

occi:action.title: Operation to pre-configure the source endpoint.
Operation to pre-configure the target endpoint.
Operation to post-configure the source endpoint.
Operation to post-configure the target endpoint.
Operation to remove a target node.
Operation to notify the source node of a target node being added via a relationship.
Operation to notify source some property or attribute of the target changed

occi:mixin.title: The TOSCA root Relationship Type all other TOSCA base Relationship Types derive from

occi:attribute.name: tosca.name
occi:attribute.title: This attribute reflects the name of the Relationship Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

occi:attribute.name: state
occi:attribute.title: The state of the relationship instance.

occi:attribute.name: tosca.id
occi:attribute.title: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Relationship Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

occi:mixin.title: This type represents a network connection relationship between two nodes.

occi:attribute.name: credential
occi:attribute.title: The security credential to use to present to the target endpoint to for either authentication or authorization purposes.

occi:mixin.title: This type represents an intentional network routing between two Endpoints in different networks.
This type represents a hosting relationship between two nodes.
This type represents a general dependency relationship between two nodes.
